author: Sonali Basak
title: Guggenheim Hires RBC’s Andrew Schwartz as Global Credit Head
text:
Guggenheim Partners hired Andrew Schwartz from Royal Bank of Canada as head of global credit at the investment banking division.
Schwartz will be a senior managing director and responsible for sales, trading, research and syndicate, Guggenheim said Tuesday in a statement.
Guggenheim Partners Chairman Alan Schwartz has been building banking operations at Guggenheim, the investment and advisory firm with more than $240 billion in assets under management. The company has added debt traders and in 2014 reached a deal to buy Lazard Capital Markets LLC’s London unit.
“We have significant momentum in our credit business, and Andrew’s expertise helping clients access debt capital markets will be a great benefit as we continue to build upon our capabilities,” the chairman said in the statement.
Andrew Schwartz was head of U.S. credit sales at RBC Capital Markets and previously worked at Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc. and Morgan Stanley, according to the statement. He isn’t related to the chairman, said Thomas Mulligan, a spokesman for Guggenheim at Sitrick & Co.
